title: @Assassin mains, can you guys like... Chill?
body:
The amount of angry posts toward the reworks, calling them Trash, gutted and other vile things is so not appropriate.

A ton of Assassin mains complain about their champions actually getting counterplay, becoming more healthy for the game and generally being more thematically unique.
And still they complain, whine and get so very agressive and rude.

Can you guys just appreciate what you're given and provide real feedback?
At least EVERY SINGLE ONE of these updates look great while stuff like the Juggernaut patch left some of the champs off worse than before and didn't get as much attention and love as the assassins.

So please, calm your tits and be objective and stop being so unconstructive

replies.body: I don't even know what the big deal is, I'm hyped for for my babies {{champion:55}} {{champion:7}}. Especially Kat's, I saw they added AD ratios to all her spells and I'm psyched to try {{item:3146}} on her when she hits live.
She always had AD ratios on half of her spells.....
Just her W and R, wasn't really anything significant aside from the latter though. With the rework, Q and E are getting AD ratios as well, while W's seems to be improved.

Q isn't really getting AD ratio. The dagger throw still has only AP ratio and the effect of picking dagger is still her old W and it already did scale with AD.
It's just that now her W is basically on no CD since it is bound to picking up the dagger and it has slight delay, and the MS buff it gave if it struck enemy champ is now classic effect of new W. Other than that it's the same.
And the base damage of the Dagger-pick scales with Level so it's more like champion passive feature rather than feature of Q and W. They should've just move the text into her Passive as paragraph "Sinister Strike" and then Q and W only mentoin that it triggers the effect.

Akali's been one of my go-to champs since the ancient times when she required a special rune page to function. The longer cooldown on her E is just a return to form for me. Having a terrible pre-6 pane phase is also just expected for Akali, so if it's somehow even worse then at least I'm prepared to deal. And eating numbers nerfs is something any long time Akali player just knows to put up with.

I'm really hoping the W changes actually make all the nerfs worth it. But that passive change...I dunno. Looks like a colossal nerf from YouTube videos I've watched today. 

Here's hoping Riot actually gives Akali some of her numbers back if she sucks too hard.

Now let us get to the meat of the issue: Rito's Class reworks.

Season 4 was when they did the Support Class rework that was widely held as BOTCHED, they then did the Juggernaut Class rework that was ALSO widely held as BOTCHED, and now comes the Assassin Class rework... Rito has fallen into a pattern with their Class reworks so you really can't hold it against the League Community to be anxious about the Assassin Class rework.

There's a difference between anxiety before something happens (which there was plenty of) and the bitching that sometimes happens afterwards, which is what this post is addressing.

There was absolutely no need for the personal attack in there, I understand that champion.gg is falliable but it's a lot more reliable than personal anecdotes when it comes to raw statistics.

Edit: Also, the support class rework was before the current process for class reworks was implemented and didn't follow the same guidelines as the current one, so it's a bit of a stretch to compare them.

I'm an assassin main of sorts. Main my man Zed, mained Akali, Fizz, LeBlanc, and of course, Kat and Talon. I'm extremely excited for the reworks to be released on the preseason.
The only thing I am pissed about is that my boy Talon is probably gonna be a perma ban/pick until he gets a nerf. Other than that, I'm even excited to learn how to play the new Katarina and the cool plays you can do with LeBlanc. They may not be perfect reworks, but Rito sure did a hell of a good job overall.

The Akali W change looks bad; the E nerf seems unnecessary, and a two auto passive on a champ with one of the clunkiest autos in the game (that if you look at your screen wrong you cancel) is also cause for concern.

Akali got Kalista'd for no reason. She is going to be the worst champion at her role (assassinating) for the entire game. Bad early game? Check (it got worse even). Bad mid game? Eh, you still have your gunblade power spike....but with the early game hit you basically have to blow your jungler to get it at a decent time due to them camping for you. Bad late game? Ratios, cds, and bases got destroyed for some reason.

It's like when they kept trying to make AP Ekko a thing by buffing his ratios but never giving AP Ekko a way to actually get AP. He had no wave clear or kill potential so he was always behind and couldn't snowball (thus tank top) and thus all the ratio buffs meant absolutely nothing. There's no way Akali is going to get enough AP to actually kill anyone and even IF she does she lost her free spell vamp so will just die in fights regardless (oh man that 190 heal will make up for 15% spell vamp).

The thing is, when riot reworks champions, they generally alienate the mains of those champions.
Reasons:
1) they put many hours into learning and understanding that champion, and that all goes to waste
2) they put many games, playing that champions, they lost elo to learn how to play that champion competitively
3) if they get "nerfed" during the rework, they will be playing their main nerfed quite heavily
4) if they get "buffed" during the rework, they will be playing a fotm champion which will become a very contested pick and less likely for them to get a chance to play it
